The curriculum is defined as a stable, machine-readable index and a set of authoritative course descriptions. It is designed to be consumed by both humans and external tools without frequent breaking changes.

Primary Sources

  • curriculum.json (machine-readable index)
  • courses/ (human-readable course descriptions)

How to Read the Curriculum

Start with the index to understand ordering and scope, then read the course files for detail. The intent is structural clarity, not pedagogical delivery.

  • Index: /curriculum.json
  • Courses: /courses/

Stability Contract

This repository is treated as a public API. Changes are conservative and explicit; meaning should not drift over time.
